title: State Compliance Rules - Enforcement Logic
description: Programmatic enforcement rules for state-specific public adjuster compliance requirements

rules.description: Public Adjusting is Illegal (Unauthorized Practice of Law)
rules.errorMessage: CRITICAL: Public Adjusting is illegal in Alabama. This constitutes Unauthorized Practice of Law (UPL). Refer client to Attorney.

legalBasis.notes: Alabama does not license public adjusters. PA activities are considered UPL.

rules.errorMessage: VIOLATION: Kansas only allows Commercial Public Adjusting. Residential claims are prohibited.

legalBasis.notes: Kansas restricts PA licensing to commercial property only. Residential PA work is prohibited.

rules.errorMessage: VIOLATION: Louisiana requires Hourly or Flat Fee billing only. Contingency/percentage fees are prohibited.

legalBasis.notes: Louisiana prohibits percentage-based fees. Only hourly rates or flat fees permitted.

rules.errorMessage: VIOLATION: Fee exceeds Florida's 10% statutory cap (F.S. 626.854).

legalBasis.notes: Florida implemented 10% cap for all PA contracts effective Dec 16, 2022. No exceptions for emergency or pre-loss contracts.

consequences: Administrative fines up to $5,000 per violation

rules.errorMessage: VIOLATION: Illinois limits public adjuster fees to 10% of claim recovery.

legalBasis.notes: Illinois caps PA fees at 10% of total claim settlement.

rules.errorMessage: VIOLATION: Tennessee limits public adjuster fees to 10% of claim recovery.

legalBasis.notes: Tennessee caps PA fees at 10% of settlement amount.

rules.errorMessage: WARNING: Texas prohibits PA solicitation for 72 hours after disaster declaration (TIC § 4102.051).

legalBasis.notes: Cannot solicit in disaster area for 72 hours after Governor's disaster declaration.

rules.errorMessage: VIOLATION: NC prohibits PA solicitation for 48 hours after hurricane landfall.

legalBasis.notes: Post-hurricane solicitation restrictions. Cannot solicit within declared disaster area.

rules.errorMessage: REQUIREMENT: Puerto Rico law requires all consumer contracts to be in Spanish.

legalBasis.notes: All consumer-facing contracts must be available in Spanish. English-only contracts are voidable.

rules.errorMessage: WARNING: New York PAs cannot provide legal advice. UPL violations may result in criminal prosecution.

legalBasis.notes: PAs must avoid unauthorized practice of law. Cannot advise on litigation strategy, legal rights, or settlement negotiations involving legal interpretation.

ruleCategories.LICENSE_RESTRICTION: States where PA activities are restricted or prohibited
ruleCategories.FEE_CAP: States with statutory maximum fee limits
ruleCategories.FEE_STRUCTURE: States with specific fee type requirements
ruleCategories.CONTRACT_REQUIREMENT: States with specific contract format requirements
ruleCategories.SCOPE_OF_PRACTICE: States with UPL and scope limitations

logicTypes.FORBIDDEN_ACTION: Action is completely prohibited (e.g., PA in AL)
logicTypes.FORBIDDEN_KEYWORD: Specific keywords trigger violations (e.g., residential in KS)
logicTypes.FORBIDDEN_FEE_TYPE: Certain fee structures are illegal (e.g., percentage in LA)
logicTypes.DYNAMIC_CAP: Fee caps vary by circumstances (standard vs emergency)
logicTypes.TIME_BASED_RESTRICTION: Restrictions based on time after event
logicTypes.LANGUAGE_REQUIREMENT: Contracts must be in specific language
logicTypes.FORBIDDEN_SERVICE: Certain services are outside scope of practice

severityLevels.BLOCK_ACTION: Prevent action completely - violation is illegal
severityLevels.WARN_BLOCK: Warn user strongly but allow override with acknowledgment

integrationNotes.frontend: Use these rules to validate contracts before submission
integrationNotes.backend: Enforce rules at API level to prevent circumvention
integrationNotes.ai: AI assistant must reference these rules when advising on state compliance
integrationNotes.audit: All rule violations/warnings must be logged for compliance audits
